availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert S. Montague (Taylor County, Kentucky, attorney and county clerk)

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, attorney and county clerk. Harrodsburg, Kentucky, native. Son of James Montague. Married to Margaret E. Cox in 1847. Father of Sallie E. Montague, Virginia Montague, Mary Montague, and Margaret Montague. Attorney in Campbellsville, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Carthage, Illinois, in 1860. Employed Mary A. Troutman as a servant in Carthage in 1860. Attorney in Taylor County in 1863. County clerk of Taylor County from December 1864 to October 1866.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 194A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Hancock County, Carthage, p. 677.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 235B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Taylor County, 1863, p. 115 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1866,” in 1866 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 347-350.
Find A Grave, "Robert S. Montague (1824-1900)," Memorial 71065692, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/71065692 (accessed June 22, 2017).
George William Montague, History and Genealogy of Peter Montague, of Nansemond and Lancaster Counties, Virginia, and his Descendants, 1621-1894, (Amherst, MA: Press of Carpenter & Morehouse, 1894), 210.
KYR-0001-004-1383.
